Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: P-0-0070 "motor continuous stall torque" is greater than P-0-0073 "motor peak torque"

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} ASM don't supports usage of P-0-0077
{0}{1,X}{2} Invalid torque characteristic data.
{0}{1,X}{2} Invalid inductance characteristic data.
{0}{1,X}{2} Got no memory.
{0}{1,X}{2} Motor management: Invalid motor data.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Motor data are missing for the calculation of the motor characteristic curve.

CauseRemedy.Cause: If at least one of the following functions - speed limitation (P-0-0451), current limitation (P-0-0451) or field weakening operation (P-0-0455) - is activated, the following parameters must be valid.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the following IDNs: P-0-0055; P-0-0066; P-0-0070; P-0-0073; P-0-0077 and S-0-0196 (If no rated motor current is entered, the motor standstill current is used).

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Motor management: Voltage error

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The mains voltage range entered is not permissible for the field weakening operation with synchronous motors.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The permissible range of the voltage value for the field weakening operation "U_mains-min and U_mains-max" of the IDN P-0-455 is calculated during initialization and compared with the parametrized value in the IDN P-0-0201.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: "U_mains-min" less than (P-0-0201 minus P-0-0203) and "U_mains-max" greater than (P-0-0201 plus P-0-0202). Check the IDNs for plausible values.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Motor management: Current error

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The parametrized current value does not correspond to the calculated value (field weakening operation).

Detail.Name: Info
Detail.Text: AX5000_IDN-Description: "P-0-0455"

CauseRemedy.Cause: The desired operating point is set in the TCDriveManager on the field weakening curve (slider). The current value resulting from this is automatically entered into the IDN P-0-0455; if this IDN is changed manually it can become invalid.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the IDN P-0-0455 and restart the servo drive if necessary.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Invalid parameter: Switching frequency of the IGBT module is not supported

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The parametrized switching frequency of the IGBT module P-0-0001 is not supported.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Invalid parameter: Motor continuous stall force > motor peak force

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: P-0-0126 "motor continuous stall force" is greater than P-0-0128 "motor peak force"

Detail.Text: The possible maximum feedback speed is too high. Check S-0-0113, P-0-0150/P-0-0180, P-0-0152/P-0-0182, P-0-0153/P-0-0183.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} The current feedback speed is too high

Detail.Text: The current feedback speed is too high. Check S-0-0113, P-0-0150/P-0-0180, P-0-0152/P-0-0182, P-0-0153/P-0-0183.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The emergency brake function was triggered while the actual velocity was outside the standstill window. The motor brake usage is configured to 'Emergency brake'. See P-0-0060.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Current or proportial gain values are not within the permissible range
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check limitations

Detail.Text: Power management: Initialization failed

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Mains supply: U mains too high.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The measured mains voltage is higher than the parameterized supply voltage in P-0-0201 and P-0-0202.

Detail.Name: Hint
Detail.Text: Power surge error limit can be read out in P-0-0206

CauseRemedy.Cause: False parameterized mains voltage
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the parameterization and increase the mains voltage tolerance as necessary

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mains voltage is wrong
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the mains voltage

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Mains supply: U mains too low.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Mains supply: U mains too low.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Mains supply: Power down.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: A power supply failure has occurred.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mains supply is faulty.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the mains supply and rectify the fault.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Mains supply: Phase error.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: A phase of the 3-phase mains supply has failed.

Detail.Name: Hint
Detail.Text: On no account should you deactivate the phase monitoring if a phase of the 3-phase mains supply has failed, as otherwise the AX5000 will be destroyed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mains supply is faulty.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the mains supply and rectify the fault.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You are operating the AX5000 on a single-phase mains supply.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Deactivate the phase monitoring by means of IDN P-0-0204 bit 3. If you had assumed a 3-phase mains supply during the project engineering, check in the IDN P-0-0092 and P-0-0093 whether you need to enter a derating.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The 3-phase mains supply is continually afflicted by faults.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: By means of IDN P-0-0204, activate a filter that causes the phase monitoring to wait longer before triggering the error.

Detail.Text: AX5000_IDN-Description: "S-0-0203" and "S-0-0206"

CauseRemedy.Cause: The DC-link undervoltage threshold is too high

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Error Power Management: Check external DC link connection

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Error Power Management: Wrong external brake resistor found

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The determined values of the external brake resistor connected do not correspond to the parametrized values in the TCDriveManager.

Detail.Name: Hint
Detail.Text: If you have ruled out the above measurement errors, you can switch off the brake resistor check via the IDN P-0-0204 "Bit 1".

CauseRemedy.Cause: General measurement error; measure the brake resistor and compare the ohmic value determined to the data on the type label.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: If the value corresponds, deactivate the internal test of the external brake resistor: To do this, set the IDN P-0-0204 "Disable DC link interface check" to "enable". Observe the application with regard to the proper operation of the external brake resistor.

CauseRemedy.Cause: General measurement error; measure the brake resistor and compare the ohmic value determined to the data on the type label.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: If the value does not correspond, exchange the brake resistor or enter the determined ohmic value in the TCDriveManager; afterwards, switch the 24 V supply off and on again. .

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Power Management: Over-current - DC link connection

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: An over-current occurred when checking the external DC link connection X02.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Brake resistor too small.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the application and calculate the required braking power.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short-circuit on X02
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the connection on X02

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Power Management: Powersupply type is wrong

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The paramitrized powersupply type in P-0-0204 (bit 9 and bit 10) is other than found.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Powersupply type is wrong.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Change powersupply type in P204 (bit 9 and 10).

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Error Power Management: Load resistor active and axis enabled. Error reaction closed loop ramp

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Error Power Management: Load resistor active and axis enabled. Error reaction closed loop ramp

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Device rated current too high for single phase supply.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Device rated current too high for single phase supply. Change power supply type (AC1) or P-0-0093

CauseRemedy.Cause: Power supply type is wrong in P-0-0204.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Set power supply type to 3 phases (AC 3) in the IDN P-0-0204 bit 9 and bit 10.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Power supply type is single phase (AC 1)
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check in the IDN P-0-0093 whether you need to enter a derating.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Charging error.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: An charging error is occurred.

CauseRemedy.Cause: X07, terminal points for using internal brake resistor not connected.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check terminal points at X07: "+RBint" and "+RB" must be bypassed.

CauseRemedy.Cause: X07, terminal points for using external brake resistor not connected.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check terminal points at X07: external brake resistor must connected between"+RB" and "-RB".

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Option card: Interface Id is not supported.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Interface Id of the option card is not supported

CauseRemedy.Cause: The firmware of the option card and that of the AX5000 do not correspond to each another.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: The firmware of the option card and that of the AX5000 need to be updated.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Option card: Channel count is not supported.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Option card with false channel count mounted.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Mount option card with correct channel count.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Invalid identity object

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Identity object in the factory settings is invalid.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The installation of a compatibility patch failed.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Option card: Interface of the FPGA 2 not supported

Detail.Name: Description

CauseRemedy.Cause: The option card used is not compatible.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Replace the option card with a compatible version.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown firmware error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the servo drive from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the list of supported/compatible safety card types and change the card to a compatible one.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety: internal error, out of memory

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Safety: internal error, out of memory

CauseRemedy.Cause: Internal software exception.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please contact the Beckhoff drive support.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety: internal error, got no timer

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Safety: internal error, got no timer

CauseRemedy.Cause: Internal software exception.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please contact the Beckhoff drive support.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety switch off while the axis was enabled.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Safety switch off while the axis was enabled.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The safety logic has switched off the power stage of the drive while the axis was enabled. In this case the drive is losing the control over the motor and the motor must be mechanically stopped.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: The axis should be stopped and disabled before the safety logic triggers the power stage switch off.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Configured safety option don't match

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Configured safety option don't match

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} The basic unit of the drive don't supports a safety option.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The basic unit of the drive don't supports a safety option.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The basic unit of the drive isn't prepared for the integration of a safety card.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Remove the safety card or exchange the drive to one with safety support.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety Option: Not supported firmware index.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Safety Option: Not supported firmware index.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The firmware or hardware version of the safety option isn't compatible with the firmware or hardware of the drive.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Exchange the safety option to a compatible one. (For detailed information contact the Beckhoff drive support.)

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety slot: No safety or dummy card inserted

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The safety slot (X3x) of the AX5000 contains neither a safety card nor a dummy card

CauseRemedy.Cause: The card was removed inadvertently.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Insert the card again in the slot.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety slot: Incompatible safety or dummy card inserted

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The safety slot (X3x) of the AX5000 contains a safety or dummy card that is incompatible to the drive.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The hardware type of the safety option isn't compatible with the hardware of the drive. E.g. a safety card for the drive harware version 1 is inserted in a drive with hardware version 2.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Exchange the safety option to a compatible one. (For detailed information contact the Beckhoff drive support.)

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety card: safety card activated - internal reaction

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The safety logic has been activated and the delay time before the power stage is switched off is running. In this delay time the drive can slow down the motor with a closed loop ramp.

Detail.Name: Hint
Detail.Text: The safety card has been triggered by a certain event. Examine all safety-relevant functions of the system that could trigger such an event.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The AX5000 is in the safe state (emergency stop circuit still active, cabling fault etc.).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Place the system in readiness for operation again.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety slot: Wrong safety card AX5805 or AX5806 inserted

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The safety slot (X3x) of the AX5000 contains a safety card (AX5805 or AX5806) that is incompatible with the device type. Please use for the AX5y01 to the AX5140 a 'AX5805' and for the AX5160 to the AX5193 a 'AX5806'.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Safety card: Internal error.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: An internal error occurred while evaluating the compatibility of the safety card.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Internal software exception.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please contact the Beckhoff drive support.

Event.Message: {0}{1,X}{2} Missing implementation!

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Missing implementation!
